2011 Chemical and Biological Defense S&T Conference Call for Papers and Sessions

The 2011 Chemical and Biological Defense Science and Technology (CBD S&T) Conference will consist largely of platform and poster presentations that will be awarded based on the quality and content of the abstracts submitted to the Conference. For the first time, the Conference is welcoming interested parties to submit proposals to host a contributed session. The Conference is particularly interested in any relevant innovations or developments that have not yet been introduced to the defense community.
The Conference welcomes abstract submissions in the following scientific areas:
- Leveraging Innovative Computational Methods for Predicting CBRN Effects
- Understanding Human Reactions to CB Events
- Disease Prediction, Outbreak Characterization and Impact Modeling
- Virtual World Development and Use for Representation of CBRN Threats
- CB Sensing and Molecular Recognition
- Host Response: Provide Molecular and Cellular Understanding of Host-Agent Interactions
- Agent Characterization: Characterize and Forecast Current and Emerging Threats
- Bio-inspired functional materials - biomimetics and beyond
- Material Design and Synthesis: Develop Novel Materials for CB Protection and Threat Mitigation
- Investigations in Rapid Response and Recovery and Technology Transition
- Threat Activity Sensing and Reporting
- Hazard Mitigation and Contamination Control
- Human Performance in a CBRN Environment
- Novel Vaccine Technologies
- Therapeutics
- Medical Countermeasures for Chemical Weapon and Radiation Exposure
- Advances in Regulatory Sciences: Flexible and Agile Biomanufacturing
- Advances in Regulatory Sciences: Rapid Enhanced Development and Evaluation
- Novel Next Generation System Platform Technologies
- Bioinformatics: Creation of a Knowledge Management System to Support Biomarker Discovery
- Pathogen ID and Characterization
- Host Biomarker Discovery
- Biosurveillance in Reservoir Hosts and Vectors
Proposals for contributed sessions are sought in all areas of Chemical and Biological Defense, including, but not limited to:
- Nanotechnology
- Life Science Technologies
- Omics
- Novel Threat and Disruptive Chemical and Biological Discovery
- Dynamic Functional Materials
- Applied Mathematics and Innovative Computational Tools
- Flexible Design, Synthesis and Manufacturing
- Systems Biology and Engineering
- Disease Surveillance, Threat Detection and Point of Need Diagnostics
- Adaptive Medical Countermeasures and Technologies
- Rapid Response and Restoration Science and Technology
- Threat Activity Sensing and Reporting
The deadline for submitting abstracts and proposals is 1700 EDT on 24 June 2011.
CBRNIAC is distributing this announcement at the request of the organizers. Please contact cbdstconf11@sainc.com with any questions.
